intro: Astragalus kentrophyta var. impensus, commonly known as the redstem milkvetch, is a flowering plant species native to the western United States. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It plays a role in soil stabilization and is sometimes used in ecological restoration projects. Its seeds are often dispersed by wind, contributing to its distribution across suitable habitats.
